New Records: Elly De La Cruz joined Eric Davis and Barry Larkin as the only Reds players with 25 homers and 65 stolen bases in a season.
Key Match Events: Elly De La Cruz hit a three-run homer, drove in four runs and scored twice.
Rookie Rhett Lowder allowed five hits in five innings with a 1.40 ERA through five starts.
Ty France hit his 13th homer of the season.
Billy Cook hit a solo homer for Pittsburgh's only run.
Post-Match Reflections: Elly De La Cruz expressed pride in joining great players and feeling great about finishing strong.
Rhett Lowder reflected on making pitches in crunch time and not panicking.
Reds manager David Bell praised Lowder's maturity and preparedness.
Others: Reds' LHP Sam Moll will not pitch this season due to a left shoulder impingement.
C Austin Wynns will be shut down due to a right teres major tear.
Pirates' RHP Paul Skenes has the lowest ERA in the major leagues since debuting on May 11.
Reds' RHP Hunter Greene will come off the injured list to make his first start since August 13.
